senses.sense_definition: С усилием перемещать что-либо или кого-либо, приближая к себе или за собой.

examples.text: Возница, стоя по колени в грязи, изо всех сил <w>тянул</w> лошадь за узду и бранился.

target_lang_translations.en: The driver, standing knee-deep in mud, <w>was pulling</w> the horse by the bridle with all his might and cursing.

examples.text: Он осторожно стал <w>тянуть</w> на себя этот листик так, чтобы пригнуть вместе с ним ветку, но и не разорвать листик и успеть цапнуть ветку левой рукой.

target_lang_translations.en: He carefully began to <w>pull</w> the leaf towards himself, so as to bend the branch with it, but without tearing the leaf, and to manage to grab the branch with his left hand.

examples.text: Маленький ребёнок <w>тянул</w> маму за руку, показывая на игрушку.

target_lang_translations.en: The little child <w>was pulling</w> his mom by the hand, pointing at a toy.

target_lang_definitions.en: To move something towards you or behind you, using force.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: The most common and direct translation for applying force to move an object closer.
Implies pulling something heavy or with difficulty, often along a surface.
A more formal or literary word for 'pull', often used for pulling something out of a container (e.g., drawing a sword).

senses.sense_definition: Иметь определённый вес, весить.

target_lang_translations.en: The bale <w>weighs</w> about ten kilos.
This sack <w>weighs</w> twenty kilograms.
The fish <w>weighed</w> two kilograms.

target_lang_definitions.en: (Colloquial) To have a certain weight.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: The standard verb for stating weight.
An idiomatic way to express weight, similar to the colloquial Russian usage.

senses.sense_definition: Мешкать, медлить, не торопиться с осуществлением чего-либо; замедлять, долго не кончать, медлительно делать что-либо.

examples.text: Она понимала, что в таких случаях нельзя <w>тянуть</w> и надо что-то срочно предпринять.

target_lang_translations.en: She understood that in such cases one couldn't <w>delay</w> and had to do something urgently.
Don't <w>drag it out</w>, it's time to make a decision.

examples.text: Он всегда <w>тянет</w> с выполнением домашнего задания.

target_lang_translations.en: He always <w>procrastinates</w> on doing his homework.

target_lang_definitions.en: To delay or procrastinate; to take a long time to do something.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To postpone or put off an action or decision.
To make something take longer than necessary, often used in the idiom 'drag one's feet'.
To intentionally and habitually postpone something that must be done.

senses.sense_definition: Быть привлекательным, влечь к себе, манить, притягивать, увлекать; испытывать сильное желание чего-либо.

examples.text: Где бы ты ни был, тебя всегда <w>тянет</w> на родину, в любимый город, домой.

target_lang_translations.en: Wherever you are, you always <w>feel drawn</w> to your homeland, your beloved city, your home.

examples.text: Нормального человека всегда <w>тянет</w> к новым знаниям.

target_lang_translations.en: A normal person is always <w>drawn</w> to new knowledge.
I was always <w>drawn</w> to art.

target_lang_definitions.en: To feel a strong attraction or pull towards a place, person, or activity.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To feel an emotional or intellectual attraction to something or someone.
To feel an irresistible urge or attraction.

senses.sense_definition: Медленно произносить слова или протяжно, заунывно петь.

examples.text: Он, когда говорил о чём-нибудь серьёзно, то с напряжением <w>тянул</w> «э-э-э-э».

target_lang_translations.en: When he spoke about something serious, he would strain and <w>draw out</w> an 'uh-uh-uh-uh'.
Some beggars are <w>droning</w> prayers under the windows.
Don't <w>draw out</w> your words, speak more clearly.

target_lang_definitions.en: To speak or sing slowly and in a drawn-out manner.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To prolong the sound of words or syllables when speaking.
To sing or speak in a monotonous, droning tone.

senses.sense_definition: Дуть, приносить откуда-либо запах (также тепло, прохладу и т. п.), пахнуть.

target_lang_translations.en: From the garden <w>wafted</w> the smell of dill.

examples.text: Ночной ветер <w>тянул</w> с берега пряной духотой.

target_lang_translations.en: The night wind <w>blew</w> a spicy stuffiness from the shore.
A cool draft <w>was coming</w> from the window.

target_lang_definitions.en: To be a source of a draft, smell, or temperature change, often coming from an opening like a window or door.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: Used for air currents. For example, 'a cold draft was coming from the window'.
Used for smells carried on the air.
A more general term for air or a scent moving from a source.

senses.sense_definition: Иметь определённую цену, стоить.

target_lang_translations.en: This ring <w>is worth</w> about ten thousand.
The car repair <w>will cost</w> a decent amount.
The new house <w>is worth</w> a million rubles.

target_lang_definitions.en: (Colloquial) To be worth or cost a certain amount of money.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To have a certain monetary value.
To require a certain amount of money for purchase or repair.

senses.sense_definition: Настойчиво звать, приглашать, заставлять кого-нибудь против его воли идти с собой куда-нибудь.

examples.text: Никто ж ведь его силком не <w>тянул</w>.

target_lang_translations.en: No one <w>dragged</w> him there by force.
To <w>drag</w> a friend over for a visit.

examples.text: Она не хотела идти, но её <w>тянули</w> за собой.

target_lang_translations.en: She didn't want to go, but they <w>were dragging</w> her along.

target_lang_definitions.en: To insistently try to make someone go somewhere with you, often against their will.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To persuade or force someone to go somewhere they don't want to go.

senses.sense_definition: Вбирать что-либо откуда-либо, извлекать, втягивать, всасывать (медленно).

target_lang_translations.en: The pump <w>draws</w> water.
The plant <w>draws</w> moisture from the soil with its roots.

examples.text: Он <w>тянул</w> в себя воздух полной грудью.

target_lang_translations.en: He <w>was drawing</w> air into his lungs.

target_lang_definitions.en: To slowly absorb, suck in, or draw a substance from a source.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To pull in a liquid or gas, like a pump drawing water or a person drawing a breath.
To pull in a liquid or other substance from a source, like a plant from soil.
To extract liquid by creating a vacuum.

senses.sense_definition: Испытывать желание потянуться, расправить уставшие от однообразного положения руки, ноги, весь корпус.

target_lang_translations.en: After sitting for a long time, one's back starts to <w>ache</w>.

examples.text: Утром он всегда <w>тянет</w> мышцы перед зарядкой.

target_lang_translations.en: In the morning, he always <w>stretches</w> his muscles before exercising.

target_lang_definitions.en: To feel a pulling or aching sensation in the muscles, often creating a desire to stretch.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To experience a dull, persistent pain, often in muscles.
To feel a constricting or tense sensation in a muscle.

senses.sense_definition: Проводить, прокладывать какое-либо протяженное сооружение (например, кабель, трубу).

target_lang_translations.en: The signalmen <w>were running</w> a line.

examples.text: В прошлом году начали <w>тянуть</w> ветку газопровода.

target_lang_translations.en: Last year they started <w>laying</w> a branch of the gas pipeline.

examples.text: Рабочие <w>тянули</w> новый кабель через весь город.

target_lang_translations.en: The workers <w>were running</w> a new cable across the whole city.

target_lang_definitions.en: To install or lay something long, like a cable, pipe, or wire.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: Commonly used for installing cables or wires.
Commonly used for installing pipes or tracks.
Used when a cable is physically pulled through a conduit or space.

senses.sense_definition: Вымогать, брать от кого-либо с корыстной целью; требовать сверх меры.

target_lang_translations.en: The scribes <w>squeezed</w> the last penny out of the visitors.

examples.text: Он пытался <w>тянуть</w> деньги со своих родственников.

target_lang_translations.en: He tried to <w>get</w> money from his relatives.
You can't <w>squeeze</w> the last bit out of people.

target_lang_definitions.en: To extort or get something (especially money) from someone through pressure or persistence.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To obtain something, especially money, by force or threats.
An informal term for getting money from someone, often with difficulty or pressure.

senses.sense_definition: Походить, соответствовать какому-либо образу, оценке, мере, идеалу.

examples.text: Отель неплохой, тихий, спокойный, но на три звезды явно не <w>тянет</w>.

target_lang_translations.en: The hotel is not bad, quiet, calm, but it clearly <w>doesn't measure up</w> to three stars.

examples.text: Его знания не <w>тянут</w> на отличную оценку.

target_lang_translations.en: His knowledge <w>isn't good enough for</w> an excellent grade.

examples.text: Этот спортсмен вполне <w>тянет</w> на олимпийскую медаль.

target_lang_translations.en: This athlete is definitely <w>good enough for</w> an Olympic medal.

target_lang_definitions.en: (Colloquial) To measure up to or be good enough for a certain standard or level.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To meet a certain standard or expectation. Often used in the negative.
To be of a sufficient quality or level for something.

senses.sense_definition: Тяготеть к кому-чему-либо, устремляться, действовать в каком-либо направлении.

target_lang_translations.en: The poorest peasantry always <w>gravitated</w> towards the proletariat.
To <w>side</w> with someone.
He was always <w>drawn</w> to the sea.

target_lang_definitions.en: To gravitate towards or be aligned with a particular group, idea, or direction.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To be naturally attracted to or move towards a person, place, or idea.
To be inclined or attracted to something. (Similar to sense 41a5a07f).
To support or align with one side in a conflict or argument.

senses.sense_definition: Привлекать к чему-нибудь (обычно к ответственности, суду).

target_lang_translations.en: To <w>hold</w> accountable.
To <w>bring</w> to trial.

examples.text: Преступника <w>тянули</w> к суду за его деяния.

target_lang_translations.en: The criminal <w>was brought</w> to trial for his deeds.

target_lang_definitions.en: (Formal/Legal) To bring someone to justice or hold them accountable.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To make someone answer for their actions; to make them take responsibility.
To take someone to court for a crime.

senses.sense_definition: Содействовать, помогать кому-либо в чём-либо, способствовать продвижению.

examples.text: Взял к себе отца Хрю и <w>тянул</w> его изо всех сил по службе.

target_lang_translations.en: He took Father Khryu under his wing and <w>was pulling</w> him up the career ladder with all his might.

examples.text: Он всегда <w>тянет</w> своих друзей, помогая им в карьере.

target_lang_translations.en: He always <w>helps out</w> his friends, assisting them in their careers.

examples.text: Начальник <w>тянул</w> его по службе, несмотря на отсутствие опыта.

target_lang_translations.en: The boss <w>was promoting</w> him, despite his lack of experience.

target_lang_definitions.en: (Informal) To help someone advance, especially in their career, through influence or support.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To use one's influence to help someone else, often unfairly.
To help someone get a promotion or a better position.
To provide support or assistance to someone.

senses.sense_definition: Успешно справляться с задачей, работой, нагрузкой.

examples.text: В жару двигатель не <w>тянет</w>, дёргается при разгоне и глохнет.

target_lang_translations.en: In the heat, the engine <w>can't handle it</w>; it jerks during acceleration and stalls.
I hired an operator, but he <w>can't handle</w> the job.

examples.text: Он уже не <w>тянет</w> такую нагрузку на работе.

target_lang_translations.en: He can no longer <w>handle</w> such a workload at his job.

target_lang_definitions.en: (Informal) To be able to manage a task, workload, or performance requirement. Often used in the negative.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To be capable of dealing with a situation or workload.
To have sufficient power or capability to perform a function, especially for engines or machinery.
To successfully deal with a difficult situation.

senses.sense_definition: Изготовлять из металла (проволоку) путём волочения; обрабатывать какой-либо материал, вытягивая его.

target_lang_translations.en: To <w>draw</w> wire.
At the factory, they <w>draw</w> thin copper wire.

examples.text: Мастер учился <w>тянуть</w> серебряную нить для украшений.

target_lang_translations.en: The craftsman learned to <w>draw</w> silver thread for jewelry.

target_lang_definitions.en: To manufacture wire by pulling metal through a die.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: The specific technical term for creating wire by pulling it through a die.

senses.sense_definition: Вытягивать что-либо вверх, поднимать.

target_lang_translations.en: The pump <w>draws</w> water from the well.

examples.text: С помощью лебёдки они <w>тянули</w> груз вверх.

target_lang_translations.en: Using a winch, they <w>were pulling</w> the cargo up.

target_lang_definitions.en: To pull something upwards; to lift or hoist.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To move something to a higher position using force.
To lift something heavy, often with ropes or a machine.
To pull a liquid up from a source, like a well.

senses.sense_definition: Обладать тягой (о трубе, дымоходе, пылесосе и т. п.).

target_lang_translations.en: There's a lot of soot in the chimney; it <w>doesn't draw</w> well.
The new stove <w>draws</w> well.
This vacuum cleaner <w>has</w> very good <w>suction</w> for dust.

target_lang_definitions.en: To have a good draft or suction (of a chimney, stove, vacuum cleaner).

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: Used to describe the ability of a chimney or stove to pull air through it for combustion.
To have the force that pulls in air, dust, or liquid.

senses.sense_definition: С трудом поддерживать своё существование, жить.

target_lang_translations.en: The patient is still <w>hanging on</w>.
The family is barely <w>getting by</w> on one salary.
The old man <w>was scraping by</w> in solitude.

target_lang_definitions.en: (Colloquial) To barely manage to survive or get by, often financially or in terms of health.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To survive with difficulty, especially in terms of health.
To manage to live with very little money.
A general term for managing to survive financially.

senses.sense_definition: Двигаться один за другим, вереницей (о птицах, животных).

target_lang_translations.en: Hark! Cranes are <w>flying in a line</w> across the sky.
The birds are <w>heading</w> south.

examples.text: Каждую осень стаи гусей <w>тянут</w> на юг.

target_lang_translations.en: Every autumn, flocks of geese <w>head</w> south.

target_lang_definitions.en: (Of birds or animals) To move in a long line or flock, especially during migration.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To move towards a destination, especially during migration.
To move in a continuous flow or line.

senses.sense_definition: Пить (алкоголь) медленно, пьянствуя.

target_lang_translations.en: He <w>was downing</w> champagne by the glass.

examples.text: Он сидел в баре и медленно <w>тянул</w> пиво.

target_lang_translations.en: He was sitting in a bar and slowly <w>nursing</w> a beer.
They <w>were swigging</w> cognac from the neck of the bottle.

target_lang_definitions.en: (Colloquial) To drink alcohol slowly and continuously; to tipple.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To drink something slowly, making it last a long time.
To drink in small mouthfuls.
To drink in large gulps, especially from a bottle.

senses.sense_definition: Красть, воровать.

target_lang_translations.en: He <w>swipes</w> anything that isn't nailed down.

examples.text: Его поймали, когда он пытался <w>тянуть</w> кошелёк из сумки.

target_lang_translations.en: He was caught when he tried to <w>pinch</w> a wallet from a bag.

examples.text: Некоторые люди не могут удержаться, чтобы не <w>тянуть</w> чужое.

target_lang_translations.en: Some people can't resist <w>swiping</w> other people's things.

target_lang_definitions.en: (Slang) To steal or pilfer.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: An informal word for stealing something quickly and slyly.
A British informal term for stealing.
To steal things of small value.

senses.sense_definition: Тяготить, заставлять испытывать чувство тяжести, давления.

target_lang_translations.en: The suspenders are <w>pulling</w>.
The suit <w>is tight</w> in the shoulders.
The old belt <w>was pulling</w> tightly at the waist.

target_lang_definitions.en: (Of clothing) To feel tight or constricting.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To exert a pulling force, causing a tight or constricting feeling.
To be too small or constricting.

senses.sense_definition: Принадлежать, относиться, быть в зависимости от кого-чего-либо (обычно о территориях, населении).

target_lang_translations.en: The Novgorodian suburbs <w>belonged</w> to Veliky Novgorod.
Four villages <w>were attached</w> to the main village.

examples.text: Эти земли исторически <w>тянули</w> к соседнему княжеству.

target_lang_translations.en: These lands historically <w>belonged</w> to the neighboring principality.

target_lang_definitions.en: (Archaic/Historical) To belong to or be under the jurisdiction of a larger administrative entity.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To be the property of or part of a larger group or territory.
To be connected with or part of a larger administrative unit.

senses.sense_definition: Способствовать развитию чего-нибудь в каком-нибудь направлении (часто в отрицательном смысле).

examples.text: Оппортунисты <w>тянули</w> её назад, превращали её в мумию.

target_lang_translations.en: The opportunists <w>were pulling</w> it back, turning it into a mummy.
Innovations <w>are pulling</w> the economy forward.
His conservative views <w>were holding</w> the team <w>back</w>.

target_lang_definitions.en: To influence development in a certain direction, often negatively (to hold back) or positively (to pull forward).

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: Used with 'forward' or 'back' to indicate influencing progress positively or negatively.
To impede progress; to be a negative influence.
To slow down or hinder progress.

senses.sense_definition: Нести повинности, тягло.

examples.text: Все едят, да ни один не <w>тянет</w>.

target_lang_translations.en: Everyone eats, but no one <w>bears the burden</w>.
The peasants were forced to <w>bear</w> a heavy <w>duty</w>.

examples.text: В те времена каждый должен был <w>тянуть</w> свою долю тягла.

target_lang_translations.en: In those times, everyone had to <w>bear</w> their share of the tax.

target_lang_definitions.en: (Archaic/Historical) To bear a feudal duty or tax (тягло).

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: To carry a responsibility or burden, such as a tax or obligation.
To fulfill a required service or duty.
